sentence.idiomatic: What appetizers do you have?
Let's order a few appetizers.
We don't want any appetizers.
Our sweet and sour baby ribs are famous.
How about we order sweet and sour chili peppers?
She likes sweet and sour fish.
Only if all the players cooperate then we will be able to win the match.
These dishes go together best with this red wine.
Don't worry we will wholeheartedly cooperate with your work.
These are the new dishes our restaurant is offering.
We want to taste some classic Shanghai dishes.
This book introduces how to make some home cooked dishes.
The flavor of northerners' food is generally a little stronger.
What flavors of dishes does this kind of wine go with best?
This brand of chocolate has introduced two new flavors again.
Are there any good restaurants nearby? Please recommend one for us.
This is the digital camera she recommended to us.
I don't like to purchase the products recommended by the clerks.
All of these goods are produced in China.
This luxury car was produced in America with a history of more than forty years.
Do you know where these wines were produced?
I heard that red wine doesn't go with seafood.
These dishes can go with red wine.
When you match that pair of red shoes with this suit it looks pretty good.
We want to savor this famous dish well.
These wines are worth tasting thoroughly.
After the experts diligently tasted the wine, they felt the quality was excellent.

word.literal: sweet and sour mandarin fish with pine nuts

sentence.idiomatic: All right, that’s enough appetizers. Hmm, for hot dishes, give me an order of fried sweet and sour mandarin fish with pine nuts, six hairy crabs, an order of sweet and sour baby ribs, a black pepper beef strips, and broccoli in soup. OK, that’s all. What good wines do you have?
Sir, we have on hand a lot of high grade wines to complement different foods and accommodate our guests’ different tastes. Do you have any wine preference?
I don’t really know much about wine. Based on the dishes I have ordered, can you recommend something for me?

Sure. You've ordered quite an assortment of dishes today, and different kinds of wine can even better bring out all the different flavors. To complement fish and crab, the most suitable wine is a 2004 French White Burgundy Chardonnay.
Hmm, that sounds pretty good. Now what about to go with the meat dishes? What kind of wine would be better?
A 2004 Southern Australian Shiraz would be very suitable.
Today I’ve really gained a lot of knowledge about wine. I really can’t wait to taste these wines.

word.literal: sweet and sour mandarin fish with pine nuts
